Title: AIRCRAFT SERVICES
PrimaryContactFullname: Sherry Duenas, Contract Specialist, Phone (253) 984-3862, Fax (253) 984-5053, Email Sherry.Duenas@mcchord.af.mil - Frank Reynolds, Contract Specialist, Phone 253-984-5001, Fax 253-984-5053, Email frank.reynolds@mcchord.af.mil Sherry Duenas
Description: McChord AFB intends to establish a Fixed Price Requirement Type contract for Aircraft Services. Period of performance will be a Base Period with four (4) Option Periods. Contractor shall perform Aircraft Services tasks include Management Functions, Arrival Services, Processing Services, Departure Services, Wash and Lubrication Services, Flight Line Deicing Fluid and Wash Water Clean Up and Emergency Services. The acquisition will be accomplished as a Commercial Item in accordance with FAR 12 Utilizing Commercial Acquisition Procedures and FAR 15 Contracting by Negotiations. Offers will be evaluated utilizing Best Value Procedures. In conformance with FAR 19-1301 this acquisition is being considered for a HUBzone set-aside. If your firm is HUBzone certified and intends to propose on this acquisition, please provide the following information to the contracting officer not later than 10 days after the publication of this notice: SBA certification of HUBzone eligibility; capability statement for firm; and a positive statement that your firm intends to propose on this acquisition. Based on response the contracting officer will make a determination, if there is not a reasonable expectation of adequate competition the acquisition will conducted under 100% Small Business Set-Aside. The Standard Industry Classification (SIC) is 4581 and the Small Business size standard is $5 million annual average gross revenue for the last three (3) years. All responsible sources may submit a proposal that shall be considered by the agency. The solicitation will be issued on or about 13 Apr 2000. The solicitation and all amendments will be posted and available for viewing and downloading on the Government Electronic Posing System (EPS) site at www.eps.gov. Proposals are due by close of business (4:30pm PST) 15 May 2000.

Title: UPGRADE PRODUCT RECOVERY FACILITY
PrimaryContactFullname: Ken W Miller
Description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in subpart 12.6 as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; proposals are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. This solicitation, No F02604-00-T0092 is issued as a Request for Quotation (RFQ). Funds for this acquisition are available. This solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 97-15. This acquisition is 100% set-aside for HubZone small business. Contract Line Item(s):(CLIN) 0001; SCOPE: The project covered by this statement of work consists in furnishing all labor, equipment, and materials necessary to upgrade the 1,000-gallon used oil aboveground storage tank AST (#887) and the recyclable JP-8 AST (#888) to meet 40 CFR 112.7 overfill protection requirements at the Product Recovery Facility. AST# 888 is a double-wall steel tank consisting of two 3,000-gallon separate tanks with a single-wall outer shell. Repairs shall include the installation of an high/low level product alarm system, design, electrical connection from high/low level alarm system to automatically shut off transfer pumps when alarm activates, and the installation of visual tank gauges. In addition, and a permanent eye wash unit shall be connected to existing base utility systems. A steel ladder with railing will be installed on the west end of AST #888. USER: 56th Civil Engineer Squadron, Environmental Programs Flight, Compliance Section (56 CES/CEVC). Telephone # (623) 856-3823 x225. The Environmental Flight POL Program Manager will serve as the AF Project Manager. DESCRIPTION: The Contractor shall perform the following tasks to complete this statement of work: 1. Environmental Compliance Activities: The Contractor shall repair the existing overfill alarm system or install a Veeder-Root (VR) overfill alarm system or equal on AST nos. 887 and 888 (see Attachment 1). Veeder-Root Specifications are: 1.1. VR Guardian AST Monitoring System Item # 848590-110 - 1 unit 1.2. VR Guardian High/Low Level Sensor Item# 794390-Yxx - 3 sensors 1.3. The Contractor shall mount the AST Monitoring System Console in a fan-ventilated metal box to prevent overheating during summer months. An example of an acceptable system is located at building 1018. 1.4. The Contractor shall test the system to ensure it is accurate and operational for all three ASTs. 1.5 The Contractor shall wire the overfill alarm to the transfer pumps so that the pumps will automatically stop when the overfill alarm activates. 2. Install Visual Tank Volume Gauges: The Contractor shall install one Hersey Hydraulic Visual Gauge or equal (liquid volume in gallons) on each of the three (3) ASTs. 3. Install Permanent Eyewash Unit: The Contractor shall install a permanent eyewash unit equal to construction and design to American Health & Safety Item # 2133021 Model W9332 w/foot pedal (See Attachment 2). 3.1 The Contractor shall connect the permanent eyewash unit to the base_s water supply system. 4. Construction Activities _ Ladder/Platform at AST #888: The Contractor shall install steel ladder to hatchway at the west end of AST #888 and on the north side of the tank. Ladder shall be constructed of steel grating with dimensions of 2.5 to 3.0 feet in width and approximately 8 feet in height (similar to the existing ladder/platform on the south end/west side of AST# 888). 4.1. Ladder will be welded securely to tank and/or external framework. 4.2. Ladder shall be painted to match ASTs in color and type. 5. Piping Supports: The Contractor shall install metal piping supports on AST nos. 887 and 888. Two supports per pipe for a total of eight (8) supports. The Contractor shall seal the drilled holes in the concrete pad with JP-8 resistant silicone sealant. 6. SCHEDULE AND SUBMITTALS: The Contractor shall develop a schedule which incorporates all critical work elements and submittals described in the Statement of Work. Estimated time to complete this SOW is 6 months from receipt of the Notice to Proceed. 7. ITEMS AND DATA TO BE FURNISHED BY THE GOVERNMENT: The AF Project Manager or his designee_ will coordinate site access and site layout to include any equipment storage requirements. All required utilities clearances through 56 CES (AF Form 103s) shall be obtained by CEVC. 8. DEVIATION FROM SCOPE OF WORK: The Contractor shall not depart from nor perform work outside of this Statement of Work and criteria on which the Statement of Work is based without the written direction of the Contracting Officer (CO). If the contractor performs such work without written approval, it does so at its own risk. Any changes to this SOW will be coordinated with 56 CES/CEVC as well as the CO. 9. ACCEPTANCE OF WORK: The AF Project Manager will approve and accept all work and submittals. 10. VISIT TO SITE, PRIVATE SOURCES, AND GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES: The Contractor shall advise the AF Project Manager of each proposed visit to the site, private sources, and government agencies (federal, state, county and city) prior to each visit. 11. OTHER REQUIREMENTS: The Contractor shall be a licensed contractor registered with the State of Arizona Registry of Contractors. 12. The Contractor shall not enter into any subcontracts that are not identified in its original proposal without prior written approval of the CO. 13. An Manufacturer Distributor/Authorized Service Provider must install overfill protection alarm and monitoring equipment and submit to the Manufacturer and 56 CES/CEVC, the manufacturer_s warranty documentation for equipment installed. 14. RELEASE OF DATA: All data, reports, and materials relative to this SOW are the property of the Government and will not be released by the Contractor without written approval of the CO. 15. RESPONSIBILITY FOR FIELD WORK: The Contractor shall be responsible for all damages to persons and property that occur as a result of the Contractor_s fault or negligence in connection with field work, and shall save and hold the Government free from all claims and suits arising from such damage. This is a brand name or equal requirement the FAR Clause 52.211-6 applies. Basis of award: award will be made to the lowest-price Offeror, best demonstrating their ability to satisfy the technical capabilities of the items specified. Offerors of any equal must provide descriptive literature to this office for evaluation. Required delivery: 30 days ARO. FOB: Destination to Luke AFB, AZ. All prices shall include all Federal, State and Local taxes. The following FAR & DFARS provisions and clause(s) applies to this solicitation. FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors--Commercial Items, Far 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions-- commercial Items, FAR 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes or Executive Order--Commercial Items with addenda incorporating FAR clause(s) 52.222-26, Equal Opportunity; 52.222-35, Affirmative Action for Special Disabled and Vietnam ERA Veterans; 52.222-36, Affirmative Action for Workers with Disabilities; 52.222-41; DFARS 252.212-7001, Contract terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes or executive orders Applicable to Defense Acquisitions of Commercial Items with addenda incorporating DFARS clauses(s) 252.225-7001, Buy American Act and Balance of Payment Program, DFARS 252.204-7004 Required Central Contractor Registration (MAR 1998) (DFARS 204.7304). Offers shall be submitted in writing and received not later than 4:30 PM local time, 29 Mar 00. Arizona does not observe daylight savings time. Direct any questions or concerns to TSgt Ken Miller at (623) 856-7179 X 255. All proposals must be faxed to (623) 856-3438 or e-mail: ken.miller@luke.af.mil. ATTACHMENT 1 Veeder-Root Company Guardian AST Monitoring System Product Description The Guardian AST Monitoring System, Form NO 848590-110 is designed for compliance and inventory control aboveground storage tanks where in-tank leak detection is not required. The system is capable of monitoring one or two tanks. FEATURES: The guardian has the following features: A two-line 24-character-per-line display A cursor keypad and a keypad for stepping through menu-driven programming and operation functions A red warning indicator on the front panel to alert you of leaks and other warning and alarm conditions An internal audible warning and alarm indicator to alert you of leaks and other warning and alarm conditions. The following probe and sensor is compatible with the Guardian AST Monitoring System: 794390-YXX, High/Low Level Sensor. High/Low Level Sensors indicate delivery and overfill conditions. Will fax picture upon request! ATTACHMENT 2 Emergency Eyewash Unit Product Description Deluxe Full Body/Eye Wash Emergency Station: Eyewash station has two gentle spray outlet heads with a yellow ABS plastic bowl. Drench Shower features stay open ball valve with pull rod and a yellow ABS plastic shower head. Furnished with galvanized intermediate pipe and fittings with 9_ floor flange. 1-1/4_ inlet and outlet

Title: BASE LIBRARY SERVICES
PrimaryContactFullname: Randall Jewett, Contracting Specialist, Phone 912-257-4708, Fax 912-257-4032, Email randy.jewett@moody.af.mil - Carlos McGough, Contract Apprentice, Phone 460-4721/912-257-4721, Fax 912-257-2738, Email carlos.mcgough@moody.af.mil Randall Jewett
Description: Operation of the Base Library at Moody AFB, GA. Moody AFB Library is a general library in the Air Force Library and Information System (AFLIS). AFLIS general libraries are mission-sustaining activities, which meet the complex, multifaceted information needs of the military community. Work includes general administration of the library, collection management, financial management, marketing, public services, mission support, education support, and quality of life. The solicitation number for this procurement is F09607-00-R0015 and is issued as a Request for Proposal (RFP). This solicitation is a 100% Small Business set-aside. The Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) for this solicitation is 8231, the small business size standard is $5,000,000. The contract will be for a basic period of one (1) year with up to four (4) option years, the total contract will not exceed five (5) years. This will be awarded as a Performance Price Tradeoff (PPT) in accordance with Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) Part 15. The evaluation factors shall be past performance and price. The solicitation will be issued on or about 11 May 00. The solicitation will be available to view and download on the government Electronic Posting System (EPS) site located at www.eps.gov. No paper copies of this solicitation will be mailed. All amendments will be electronically posted as well. A copy of the solicitation will be available for review free of charge at the Contracting Office (Moody AFB, GA). This acquisition shall be solicited in accordance with FAR Part 12, Acquisition of Commercial Items. The point of contact is MSgt Randall Jewett, (912) 257-4708. The Contracting Officer is Mr. K. D. Dawsey, (912) 257-3465.

Title: COMMUNICATION FUNCTIONS
PrimaryContactFullname: Carolyn L Wood
Description: The 341st Contracting Squadron, Malmstrom AFB, MT announces this OMB A-76 acquisition as a Direct Conversion of Communications Functions at Malmstrom AFB. This is a modification to the previous synopsis, number SN435554, dated 17 Mar 2000. The solicitation should be released on or about 5 May 2000. Receipt of proposals will be 45 days after release of the solicitation. This acquisition has been changed from a Native American 8(a) set aside to a competitive 8(a) set aside under SIC code 4813 as advised by the Small Business Administration Central Office, Washington DC. The Request for Proposal is available only on the Internet at http://www.eps.gov. Potential service providers must be registered in the Central Contractor Registry (CCR) to be eligible for award. The CCR Internet site is http://ccr.edi.disa.mil/ccragent/plsql/ccr.welcome). All responsible sources may submit an offer that shall be considered by the agency. The solicitation number affixed to the announcement is for convenience and tracking purposes only, at this time. Use number F24604 98 R0010 and 341st Communications Squadron when responding to this notice. The contracting office requests only competitive 8(a) firms interested respond. This acquisition is anticipated to be a cost plus incentive fee with a fixed G&A and overhead. It is also anticipated to include a six-month phase-in, a basic performance period with four option periods and two award terms. Contract award will be made on best value to the Government using source selection procedures. Following is the narrative of the proposed services that are within the A-76 Cost Comparison Study. The narrative may not be all-inclusive, but will provide the information for you to make a reasonable assumption of the services that may be included. The 341st Communications Squadron is currently responsible to the 341 Space Wing for providing communications services to the wing and its tenant units. The contractor shall provide communications services of the Base Information Transfer Center (BITC), Base Telecommunications Center (TCC)/Data Processing Support, Visual Information to include Graphics, Photo/Video service, Network Control Center (NCC) to include Help Desk and Small Computer Management/Maintenance, Communications-Computer Information Management and Records Management (IM), Telephone Switchboard Operations, Secure Communications Maintenance, Information Assurance (IA), Land Mobile Radio Support and Service (LMR), Maintenance Control (MC), and Base Radio Maintenance. The duties include but are not limited to: BITC, expedient delivery of official mail and electronic mail to over 3,900 military personnel, while managing document security of registered, certified and express accountable mail. TCC/ Data Processing Support: Provides reliable, secure handling of base Automated Digital Network (AUTODIN) traffic (to be replaced in near future with Defense Message System). Shall provide local support for customers and systems of any Defense Megacenter with a community of interest on the base. VI: Provide visual information advice and assistance; graphic arts services and products; photographic and video studio and field location documentation; emergency graphic arts and photographic requirements; photographic and electronic image processing and printing; video duplication services and product; equipment maintenance and repair. NCC: Manages base level command, control, communications, computer and intelligence (C4I) network support, that provide the warfighter and business users the information resources needed to achieve their operational objectives. The single focal point (Help Desk) for base network management, and problem resolution. Track, control, schedule maintenance and repair of C4 assets. It is the base level central point of contact for mission Command and Control (C2) and business systems which are part of the base network. Provides hardware/software technical solutions, as hardware/software technical solutions, and accurate resource accountability. As configuration management, responsible for reviewing, coordinating, validating and processing all requirements and requisitioning of on-base computer hardware/software to include local purchase items. Responsible for maintaining network operations. Responsible to provide training to wing customers on areas within this function as required. IM: Maintains records and publications files for the functions contained in this activity. Responsible to provide administrative assistance for this activity. Telephone Switchboard Operations: Provides immediate assistance by connecting callers to appropriate agencies. Controls use of 151 telephone trunk lines, connecting approximately 4,000 telephone extensions into the defense switched network local and long distance commercial services. Maintains accurate directory of all base telephone numbers. Secure Communications Maintenance: Maintains cryptographic equipment and its associated communications equipment and associated red and black lines. IA: Manages wing level information protection programs to include Information Protection Assessment and Assistance Program (IPAP), Communications Security (COMSEC), Computer Security (COMPUSEC), Emissions Security (EMSEC), Security Awareness, Training and Education Program (SATE), Secure Telephone Unit (STU-III) User Representative, Certification Authority and System Administrator for Certification Authority Workstation of Defense Message System. LMR: Manages assets and provides radio network control and management for all wing LMR networks. Provides Spectrum Management support for all frequencies used by the 341st SW. MC: Monitors, coordinates, and controls use of manpower and materiel in support of communications maintenance. Base Radio Maintenance: Maintains Base Radio communication systems to include but not limited to: UHF AN/GRT-22, AN/GRR-24, AN/URC-119, Dictaphone Digital recorder, Malmstrom Giant Voice and Public Address support. With the exception of NCC (Help Desk), TCC, and Telephone Switchboard Operations, the functions within this activity work normal business hours with qualified personnel on call. NCC (Help Desk), TCC, and Telephone Switchboard Operations work 24 hr/ 7 day a week schedule. MC provides 24 hr/7day a week local point of contact, in addition to normal business hours, for emergency restoral of priority systems, contingency requirements and other non-routine situations. In addition to the A-76 services listed above, we have consolidated three current service requirements. They are LMR maintenance service, telephone maintenance service and cellular phone service. These service areas will not be included in the compare program for the purposes of the A-76 study. In order for a contract to be awarded, the service provider price must be less than the government costs for those areas identified as A-76 functions. The comparison for these areas will be done using the COMPARE Program. If the service provider price is determined to be higher, this solicitation will be cancelled.

Title: PRINTING THE MCCHORD AFB GUIDE

Title: MAINTAIN FIREBREAKS
PrimaryContactFullname: Thomas Anable, Contract Administrator, Phone 912-257-1500, Fax 912-257-4709, Email tom.anable@moody.af.mil - James Kessel, Contract Administrator, Phone 912-257-4713, Fax 912-257-4709, Email james.kessel@moody.af.mil Thomas Anable
Description: The proposed contract is for but not limited to maintaining existingfirebreaks at Moody AFB and Grand Bay Range, Ga. Work consists of disking (harrowing) previously constructed permanent firebreaks using a bulldozer or farm tractor with disk harrow, followed by planting and fertilizing. A total of thirty-three (33) firebreaks will be maintained. The total length of firebreaks is approximately eleven (11) miles, with individual firebreaks ranging from 200 to 4,025 feet. A table delineating individual firebreak lengths and locations is attached to the solicitation package. All work shall be in strict compliance with the Technical Provisions. This will be a firm fixed price construction contract. Magnitude of proposed project is less than $25,000. Issue date on 10 Mar 00. To obtain the solicitation, including specifications, drawings, and any amendments: purchase a paper or disk copy by contacting Dougherty Blueprint and Supply 912- 244-5598, 800-344-7997, or 912-435-5727; The Blueprint Shop 850-224- 2699; Valdosta Reprographics 912-241-7955, Datatek-USA Plan Room Services 888-539-8431, or other plan rooms; or review a copy at the contracting office; or review and/or download from this Electronic Posting System (EPS). To download from EPS choose 1) EPS for Vendors 2) USAF 3) Air Combat Command and 4) Moody. It will be the contractors_ responsibility to also obtain any amendments from one of these sources. Standard Industrial Classification Code is 1794 and $7.0 million size standard. This acquisition is set-aside for an emerging small business.

Title: OPERATION AND MANAGEMENT OF COMMUNICATIONS FUNCTIONS
PrimaryContactFullname: Richard R Jiron

Title: OPERATION AND MANAGEMENT OF COMMUNICATIONS FUNCTIONS
PrimaryContactFullname: Richard R Jiron
Description: Pre-solicitation notice. The Government currently plans on releasing the Final RFP for the F. E. Warren AFB Communications Functions Direct Conversion on or about 5 Jun 00. Base Communications Functions consists of performing tasks to include operation of the Missions Systems Flight, Information Systems Flight, and the Support Flight as described in the Statement of Work (SOW). The Missions Systems Flight is responsible for base communications, telephone systems, and cable plant operations. The Missions Systems Flight provides maintenance and repair of C4I equipment in support of the 90th Space Wing. In addition, this flight meets all current and future base communications infrastructure needs, including base cable, telephones, and public address. The Information Systems Flight is responsible for providing base support including C4 systems security, network management and control, information distribution, and records management. In addition, the current postal service contract requirements will be included in this acquisition which provides for delivery of mail to dormitories and management of the general mail service for incoming personnel. The Support Flight is responsible for providing high quality digital graphic, digital photography, multi-media services video production, and publications and forms. Services are currently performed in-house by Government personnel with exception of the postal service center services and shall be provided for F.E. Warren AFB including tenants and other off-base activities requiring support. The requirement will include a 90 day phase-in period, a six (6) month base period, and five (5) one year option periods. This acquisition is 100% set-aside for small business under standard industrial code (SIC) 4813 with a size standard of 1500 employees. Offerors are requested to submit proposals as described in Section L of the RFP. The acquisition will be accomplished in accordance with Federal Acquisition Regulations and OMB Circular A-76 as a Direct Conversion. Offers will be evaluated in accordance with AFFARS Part 15 and related supplements. This solicitation will be available via the Internet at the www.eps.gov. Faxed or telegraph offers will not be accepted.

Title: PROVIDE HAZARDOUS WASTE OPERATIONS & EMERGENCY RESPONSE TRAINING, MOODY AFB, GA
PrimaryContactFullname: Brian Mentel, Contract Specialist, Phone 912-257-2959, Fax 912-257-4032, Email brian.mentel@moody.af.mil - Gary Hall, Contract Administrator, Phone 912-257-1502, Fax 912-257-4032, Email gary.hall@moody.af.mil Brian Mentel
Description: HAZARDOUS WASTE OPERATIONS & EMERGENCY RESPONSE (HAZWOPER). Furnish all management, tools, supplies, equipment, labor and supervision necessary to provide the presentation of a 40 hour Hazardous Waster Operations and Emergency Response course IAW OSHA regulations for 60 persons. Seminar to be presented on or about 17 _ 20 April 2000. Subjects shall include but are not limited to OSHA Regulations, Safety Hazards Recognition and Prevention, Health Hazards Recognition and Prevention, Personal Protective Equipment, Instrumentation, Confined Space, and Hazard Control. Provide a qualified instructor to present the course, training material to include student workbooks, slides, etc and student critique/feedback sheets. The Government shall provide properly furnished facility and equipment items common to a classroom environment. The solicitation number for this procurement is F09607-00-T0141 and is issued as a Request for Quote (RFQ). The Standard Industry Classification (SIC) is 8249. The solicitation will be issued on or around 09 Mar 00.

Title: CONSTRUCTION OF NEW CHILDCARE CENTER, DULSKI FED. BLDG., BUFFALO, NY
Office: PBS R2 UPSTATE NY SRVCE CTR
PrimaryContactFullname: Mitchell L. Gasbarra
Description: Notice is hereby provided of the Government requirement to procure for the construction of a new Childcare Center (approx. 8,000 SF) with an outside Playground area (approx. 3,500 SF) at the Thaddeus J. Dulski Federal Building, Buffalo, NY. The successful contractor shall furnish all necessary labor, materials, and supervision. The proposed construction includes, but is not limited to selective demolition, new partition, ceilings, electrical power & lighting, HVAC, plumbing, site work, fencing, playground surface and hazardous material abatement. This procurement is open to competition among both small and large business concerns pursuant to the Small Business Competitiveness Demonstration Program (FAR subpart 19.10). The magnitude of this construction project is estimated between $1,000,000.00 and $5,000,000.00. The standard industrial classification (SIC) code is 1542 and the size standard is $17.0 million. Performance and payment bonds will be required following award pursuant to the Miller Act. A bid guarantee is also required. The solicitation will contain a 10% price evaluation preference for HUBZone small business concerns pursuant to FAR 52.219-4 and a 10% price evaluation adjustment for small disadvantaged business concerns pursuant to FAR 52.219-23. A small business subcontracting plan will be required from large business concerns pursuant to FAR 52.219-9, Alternate I. The required construction completion date is 300 days commencing one day after the notice to proceed. The tentative solicitation issuance date is March 29, 2000. Bid opening is tentatively scheduled for May 2, 2000. All requests for the solicitation will only be provided in response to written, facsimile, or electronic mail requests. All responsible sources may submit a bid that will be considered by the agency. Contractors are requested to provide a street address as drawings and specifications cannot be delivered to a post office box. No telephonic requests will be honored for this solicitation. Mail requests to General Service Administration Property Management Center, James M. Hanley FB, Rm 1350, 100 So. Clinton St., Syracuse, NY 13261.

PrimaryContactFullname: Doug Janders
Description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in subpart 12.6 as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement Constitutes the only solicitation; proposals are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. This solicitation, No F02604-00-T0090 is issued as a Request for Quotation (RFQ). This solicitation Document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 97-11. This acquisition is 100% set-aside for small business SIC: 3564 Size Std: 500 employees. Services Nonpersonal: Contractor to provide all labor, tools, parts, materials, transportation, devices, supervision and other items necessary for the installation and replacement for parts for a Deltech Del-Monox Air Purification System Model #3K11 and #5N12. Model #3K11 needs replacement of Sensor Kit for CO Monitor, Pre-filter, Four(4) Final filters, and Catalyst Vessel. Model #5N12 needs Replacement of Pre-filter, Four (4) Final filters, a Catalyst Vessel and labor to replace vessels using customer supplied material. The bid needs to include maintenance for four (4) quarterly visits in a one-year period to inspect, service and change final filters. Filters are to be installed in a paint booth at Bldg 1019 located on Luke AFB, AZ. Period of service: Mar 2000 _ Feb 2001. Basis of award: award will be made to the lowest-price Offeror, best demonstrating their ability to satisfy the technical capabilities of the items specified. Required delivery: as specified after receipt of award. FOB: destination to Luke AFB, AZ. All prices shall include all Federal, State and Local taxes. Title: REQUEST FOR INFORMATION (RFI) SOURCES SOUGHT NOTICE FOR MARKET RESEARCH
PrimaryContactFullname: Ron MM Dean
Description: DESCRIPTION: This is a sources sought announcement only. There is no solicitation available at this time. This synopsis is issued for the sole purpose of the HQ AFRC/LGCP office to conduct market research in accordance with the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) Part 10. This effort is to seek qualified sources capable of providing records management, education and training, supply and equipment support, interior design management, and multimedia services for HQ. Air Reserve Personnel Center (ARPC), Denver CO. Furthermore, this RFI also seeks commercial information on the types of services captured in the attached Statement of Need (SON). ARPC is in the process of conducting an Office of Management and Budget (OMB) Circular A-76 Cost Comparison Study for the aforementioned services. Request interested parties to submit a brief description of their companies business size (small, large etc.), and a description of similar services offered to government and/or commercial customers (include point of contact). All interested parties shall be responsible for completing the market research survey included with this synopsis in order to receive a future solicitation package for this requirement. Additionally, furnish a company point of contact (POC), including address, e-mail, phone number etc. Please limit capability statement to no more than ten pages. This synopsis does fulfil the synopsis required by OMB Circular A-76. This RFI is not a commercial solicitation in accordance with FAR Part 12, and the government will not pay for any cost associated with providing this information. All comments must be addressed to the contracting office POC referenced herein. Oral presentations by interested parties shall not be entertained at this time. Following is a Statement of Need giving a brief description of the services included in this OMB Circular A-76 Cost comparison Study.

Title: REPLACE LAMPS AT APRON B AND C130 APRON
PrimaryContactFullname: Brian Mentel, Contract Specialist, Phone 912-257-2959, Fax 912-257-4032, Email brian.mentel@moody.af.mil - Gary Hall, Contract Administrator, Phone 912-257-1502, Fax 912-257-4032, Email gary.hall@moody.af.mil Brian Mentel
Description: REPLACE AIRFIELD LAMPS. Furnish all management, tools, supplies, equipment, labor and supervision necessary to replace all high pressure sodium (HPS), metal halide (MH) and obstruction lamps. Lamp fixtures are mounted on thirteen 140 ft poles. Poles have steps, safety line and work platform. HPS lamps (Apron B), 129 ea, 1000W, GE Catalog #C693N505 NEMA 6X2 Spread or equivalent. HPS lamps (C-130 Apron), 60 ea, 1000W DayBright # SFG1000HS3MT or equivalent. Obstruction lamp (Apron B), 14 ea, 165W, 1950 lumen, P-25 bulbs, 130 V, clear, krypton filled, rated life 8000 hrs, Sylvania cat number 1950/25/8 or equivalent. Obstruction lamp (C-130 Apron), 12 ea, 116W, 116W, A21/TS lamp 120V. Remove any failed ballast and provide for testing prior to proceeding with replacement. Replacement ballast shall be Eye Ignitron Ballast, part number CWA-HPF or equivalent if requested in writing and approved by the Contracting Officer. All fixtures shall be cleaned with clean soft cloths. Contractor shall provide all safety rigging and equipment. Contractor shall make all replaced components available, before departing Moody AFB, to the Base Civil Engineer Exterior Electric Shop for testing. Provide breakdown to include material and labor for replacement of lamps and ballast. The Government will verify all failed ballast. Project to be completed within 14 days of notice to proceed. Performance hours shall be 7:00AM to 4:00 PM, Monday through Friday excluding weekends and Federal holidays. The solicitation number for this procurement is F09607-00-T0059 and is issued as a request for quote (RFQ). The standard industry classification (SIC) is 1731. The solicitation will be issued on or around 14 Feb 00.

Title: CLEAN HVAC SYSTEM, 9 MILITARY FAMILY HOUSING UNITS
PrimaryContactFullname: Brian Mentel, Contract Specialist, Phone 912-257-2959, Fax 912-257-4032, Email brian.mentel@moody.af.mil - Gary Hall, Contract Administrator, Phone 912-257-1502, Fax 912-257-4032, Email gary.hall@moody.af.mil Brian Mentel
Description: CLEAN HVAC (Heating and Air Conditioning System): Furnish all management, tools, supplies, equipment, labor and supervision necessary to clean HVAC (Heating and Air Conditioning System), Military Family Housing, Moody Air Force Base Georgia.Housing management designates units. Contractor provides all personnel, equipment, tools, materials and service to clean the HVAC System (inclusive of: duct, vents, intakes, returns, blowers, coils and housing systems). System should be checked prior to cleaning to insure that all components of the system are in place and operating properly. This includes inspection of the duct lines, (trunk and tab lines), system wiring and operation of thermostat. The system components (ceiling vents, wall vents, and intake vents) should be removed with care preventing any damage to sheetrock or walls. The blower shall be removed and cleaned. The coil shall be removed and cleaned. The duct system shall be brushed to loosen any mildew, mold, dust, dust mites, or foreign objects in the lines. Upon completion, the lines shall the high pressure vacuumed to insure removal. All areas where interior system walls are fibers shall be coated with a material that prevents separation. All items removed to perform the cleaning process shall be reinstalled. The system should then be tested to insure proper operation. All work shall be completed within 15 days of notice to proceed. The solicitation number for this procurement is F09607-00-T0082 and is issued as a Request for Quote (RFQ). The Standard Industry Classification (SIC) is 7349. The solicitation will be issued on or around 14 Feb 00.

PrimaryContactFullname: Ronnie Rangel, Contract Specialist, Phone (253) 984-5131, Fax (253) 984-3288, Email Ronnie.Rangel@mcchord.af.mil - Harry Goodchild, Contract Specialist, Phone (253) 984-3878, Fax (253) 984-5053, Email Harry.Goodchild@mcchord.af.mil Ronnie Rangel
Description: This notice was erroneously coded as classification R and was re-posted as F45603-00-R-8005 with correct classification code Z on 11 Feb 2000.ESTIMATED ISSUE DATE: 2 MAR 2000. ESTIMATED COST RANGE: Between $500,000 and $1,000,000. The work covered in this project consists of furnishing all plant, labor, equipment and materials for the construction work at McChord AFB, WA. The following items are a brief summary of the project and are provided solely for the purpose of revealing the general nature of the work involved. The Contractor is responsible for accomplishing all items of work in accordance with the applicable drawings, specifications and provisions of the contract. Upgrade interior finishes to include vinyl composition flooring with base, carpet with base, suspended acoustical ceiling tiles, cabinets and countertops. Replace selected doors and hardware. Provide two (2) windows to match existing windows, Room 121, east wall. Provide interior window with 1-way glass. Provide interior signage. Upgrade existing toilet facilities to meet ADA requirements. Provide drinking fountains to meet ADA accessibility requirements. Upgrade electrical systems and replace light fixtures as shown. Upgrade fire detection system. Total contract performance period is 180 continuous calendar days. The proposed procurement is being issued as an unrestricted acquisition. Award will be made to the offeror who the Government determines can best accomplish the necessary work to satisfy the requirement set forth in the RFP in a manner most advantageous to the Government. Offer guarantee is required. For information purposes, the applicable Standard Industrial Classification Code (SIC) is 1542. Copy of the solicitation will be available through CD ROM. Any amendments will be available through EPS.

Description: The work shall consist of furnishing all plant, labor, equipment and materials to complete construction work, Project NO. Title: IATA DANGEROUS GOODS, TWO-DAY SEMINAR
PrimaryContactFullname: Sebastian Teodor, Contract Administrator, Phone (530) 634-3413, Fax (530) 634-3311, Email Sabastian.Teodor@beale.af.mil Sebastian Teodor
Description: SERVICES, NON-PERSONAL: training seminar-InternationalAir Transportation (IATA) requirements on handling explosive dangerous goods for commercial air transport, i.e. FEDEX. Contractor will provide IATA-qualified instructor and will include: program course workbooks, use of IATA Regulation handbooks and certifications to have 12 personnel be IATA certified. The class session must be on-site seminar and cover commercial air transportation procedures when handling explosive dangerous goods, will include the procedures on filling out a Shipper_s Declaration for Dangerous Goods. This course must be IATA approved. The instructor must be able to teach proper shipping procedures of life-saving appliances, parachutes and survival kits, in accordance with IATA standards. Hotel accommodations, travel expenses, and per diem for the instructor must be arranged by training school and be included in quote. The training location will be BEALE AFB, CA 95903 (approx. 55 miles N of Sacramento, CA in Yuba City/Marysville area). Class dates: 15-16 Feb 2000, Hours: 0800-1600.

Title: POWER GENERATOR, 3 PHASE
PrimaryContactFullname: Sebastian Teodor, Contract Administrator, Phone (530) 634-3413, Fax (530) 634-3311, Email Sabastian.Teodor@beale.af.mil Sebastian Teodor
Description: Power generator, 15 kW, 3 phase, 120/208 V, 60Hz. Remote start operation capability, safety circuit features to include emergency shut down for high coolant temperature, over speed, and low oil pressure. Oil pressure and coolant temperature gauges are required. Unit requires voltage meter, amperage meter, and kilowatt meter. Unit will be installed indoors and will not require a housing to protect from weather. Unit needs engine coolant block heater and a battery charger to maintain a float/equalize charge on starting batteries (batteries not needed). Also include all technical data for electrical and electronic, troubleshooting manuals, engine troubleshooting and service repair manuals, as well as parts manuals. KOHLER P.N. 15ROY/ROZ or equal.

Title: F-4 AIRCREW TRAINING AND COURSEWARE REVISION
PrimaryContactFullname: Millicent Holder, Contract Manager, Phone 757-764-4247, Fax 757-764-9695, Email millicent.holder@langley.af.mil - Jeanette Spreemann, Contracting Officer, Phone 757-764-7464, Fax 757-764-9695, Email jeanette.spreemann@langley.af.mil Millicent Holder
Description: Nonpersonal services to provide Contract Aircrew Training and Courseware Development services for the German Air Force on the F-4 aircraft. The place of performance, for both aircrew training and courseware development, shall be at Holloman AFB, New Mexico. The government anticipates the award by 12 May 00, with the contractor assuming full responsibility for contract performance on 1 Oct 00. The contract will be awarded with a 60-day phase-in, a basic contract year and four one-year options. This action will be issued as a Request for Proposal (RFP) on or about 01 Mar 00 via the Internet. A Pre-proposal Conference will be held at Holloman AFB, New Mexico on 02 Mar 00. The date for the Pre-proposal Conference is fixed, and, therefore, is not subject to change. Proposals will be due approximately 03 Apr 00. Draft RFP documents will be posted on EPS starting on or about 15 Dec 99. Interested parties should review these documents carefully and provide any comments via return email to this office (email capability provided on the Internet). The Air Force will consider and respond to all input received, both positive and negative. It is imperative that industry participates actively and fully in this _draft RFP._ In this manner, the Air Force hopes to maximize the benefits of the acquisition process for both industry and the government. The government plans to use the Internet and email as the primary means of disseminating and exchanging information. All interested parties are encouraged to limit correspondence to these media forms. Hard copies of solicitation information will NOT be made available. This procurement is set-aside 100 percent for small business. The SIC for this acquisition is 8299 and the size is $18.5M for small businesses. Interested firms should provide their company name, address, and point of contact, phone and fax number, email address, and business size to Lt. Misty Holder via email. This information will be placed on the F-4 Aircrew Training and Courseware Revision source list and will be used to notify potential offerors of major changes/amendments to draft or solicitation documents. However, it is the offeror_s responsibility to monitor the Internet for the solicitation_s release to the Internet. All responsible sources may submit an offer that will be considered. The point of contact for this acquisition is Lt. Misty Holder at the address above or email millicent.holder@langley.af.mil or phone (757) 764-4247.

Title: POLISH AND CLEAN F-16 AIRCRAFT CANOPIES
PrimaryContactFullname: Doug Janders
Description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format insubpart 12.6 as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement Constitutes the only solicitation; proposals are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued.This solicitation, No F02604-00-AQ001 is issued as a Request for Quotation (RFQ). This solicitation Document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 97-15. This acquisition is 100% set-aside for small business SIC: 7699 Size Std: $5.0 million. Luke AFB Arizona, is looking at the possibility of establishing a BPA (Blanket Purchase Agreement) for 5 (five) years, for the following service: We are seeking an agency to polish and clean F-16 model fwd 350 knot type I or II Aircraft Canopies (transparencies), made by either Texstar or Sierricin. These transparencies require in-depth polishing and cleaning because of excessive hazing, and scratches due to the natural desert environment and harsh flying atmosphere in the Luke area. REQUIRED RESULTS: After work is accomplished, transparencies must be free of all surface scratches and hazing with a definite improvement to transparency clarity. Transparency acrylic can be ground down no more than a total of 21 mils of an inch during its total life span. A detailed record must be provided to keep track of this restriction. LOCATION OF WORK: 56th Egress Shop, 6795 N. 146th Dr., Luke AFB AZ 85309. Material compatibility: All cleaning and polishes must be tested and approved by (Lockheed). Point of contact for testing is as follows: OO-ALC/LGFMM, Attention: James Arnold, 2Lt, USAF, Canopy Engineer, 1080 Gum Lane Bldg 1212, Hill AFB, UT 84056, Phone: (801) 777-9603, Fax: (801) 777-9451. Basis of award: award will be made to the lowest-price Offeror, best demonstrating their ability to satisfy the technical capabilities of the items specified. FOB: Destination to Luke AFB, AZ. All prices shall include all Federal, State and Local taxes. Period of acceptance of offers: the offeror agrees to hold the prices in its offer firm for 90 calendar days from the date specified for the receipt of offers. The following FAR & DFARS provisions and clause(s) apply to this solicitation. FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors--Commercial Items, Offerors shall include with the submission of their offer a complete copy of the provision at FAR 52.212-3, Offeror Representation and Certification-Commercial Items. Far 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions---Commercial Items. FAR 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes or Executive Order--Commercial Items with addenda incorporating FAR clause(s) 52.222-41, Service Contract Act. 52.223-3, Hazardous Material Identification and Material Safety Data. 52.223-5, Pollution Prevention and Right-to-Know Information. 52.222-26, Equal Opportunity. 52.222-35, Affirmative Action for Special Disabled and Vietnam ERA Veterans. 52.222-36, Affirmative Action for Handicapped Workers. 52.222-41,Service Contract Act of 1995, as Amended. DFARS 252.212-7001, Contract terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes or executive orders Applicable to Defense Acquisitions of Commercial Items with addenda incorporating DFARS clauses(s) 252.225-7001, Buy American Act and Balance of Payment Program. To be considered for award, bidders must also comply with DFARS 252.204-7004, Required Central Contractor Registration and DFARS 252.232-7009, Payment by Electronic Funds Transfer. Central Contract registration can be obtained through the Internet at www.ccr2000.com/ or by calling (888) 227-2423. The applicable Service wage Determination is #94-2023 Rev. 13, Dated 01 Jun 99. Offers shall be submitted in writing and received not later than 4:30 PM local time, 11 Feb 00. Arizona does not observe daylight savings time. Direct any questions or concerns to Pat Morin at (602) 856-7179 X 232. All proposals may be faxed to (602) 856-3057 or e-mail: pat.morin@luke.af.mil.

Title: TEST TRACK RAIL WELDING
PrimaryContactFullname: James Cunningham, Contract Specialist, Phone 505-572-5290, Fax 505-572-2107, Email james.cunningham@holloman.af.mil - Eldonna Fernandez, Contract Specialist, Phone 505-572-7934, Fax 505-572-2107, Email Eldonna.Fernandez@holloman.af.mil James Cunningham
Description: Holloman Air force Base is seeking qualified sources to perform electric flash butt crane rail welding. This specialized welding will be used to weld joints on 60 foot segments of #171 crane rail at the High Speed Test Track (HSTT) at Holloman Air Force Base, New Mexico. The contractor will be required to perform the following:1. Aligning the rail segments (rail head top center line) vertically and horizontally within .030 inches. 2. Flash-Butt welding the joint 3. Trimming the excess upset rail material. 4. Finish grinding the joint smooth 5. Checking with straight edges for smoothness and straightness (the desired end product is smoothness/flatness on the five rail-head surfaces such that there is no deviation greater than .030 inches over a 52 inch segment centered on the joint). 6. Checking the weld integrity using "mag particle" technique 7. Provide a certification report on the weld joint. In addition, it is required to tension the joined rail to a "zero" tension at 140 deg F, i.e. produce a tensile stress of 14,500 psi in the rail at 70 deg F. Any contractor that would like to be included in future solicitations for contract actions for this item should fax company address and point of contact to (505) 572-2107.

Title: GOLF CART LEASE
PrimaryContactFullname: Ron Riley, Contract Specialist, Phone (623)856-3436 x236, Fax (623)856-3057, Email ron.riley@luke.af.mil Ron Riley
Description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in subpart 12.6 as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; proposals are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. This solicitation, No. F02604-99-Q0077 is issued as a request for quotation (RFQ). Statement of Requirements: the 21st Fighter Squadron has a requirement for the lease of 1 (one) golf cart to be used by Taiwan personnel while assigned to Luke AFB, Arizona training program for a period of 36 months. Payment terms shall be zero dollars down, prorated on a monthly basis to be paid in arrears. The month lease rate shall include all applicable federal, state, and local taxes, including licensing fees, and all other fees as may be required by law. The lease price shall include and provide for extended service plan providing for regularly scheduled maintenance as recommended by the manufacturer Funds for this acquisition are available. This solicitation document, incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 97-12. This acquisition is reserved for small business; SIC: 3799; Size Std.: 500 employees. General characteristics of each golf car listed below include the following: 72 Volt shunt GE motor, front wheel drive direct-coupled Dana Spicer differential, GE solid state controller with: key switch input, high pedal disable, under voltage detector, regenerative braking, zero speed detect, and thermal sensor protection; 4 ply street rated tires, nine 8 volt deep cycle batteries, 72 volt DC charger using 110 AC house current, 4 wheel hydraulic brakes, parking brake, independent front suspension, automotive style rack and pinion with permanently sealed tie rod ends, aluminum welded space frame using custom aluminum alloy extrusions, bench style seats capacity per seat - 2, automotive designed safety belts, Quartz halogen headlights, high mounted tail lights, tinted front safety glass with wipers, composite and thermo-plastic body panels, horn, rubber floor mats, safety handles, rear and side reflectors, rearview and dual outside exterior mirrors and dual controllable speed ( turf 12-15mph, street 20-23 mph). Contract Line Item (CLIN) 0001: GEM 825E-2 passenger long bed. FOB point shall be destination. All line items shall be delivered within 90 calendar days ARO. Award will be based solely upon price and price related factors. Any equal offered must be clearly identified by brand name, make and model number. Offerors of any equal must also include descriptive literature and any proposed modifications making an _or equal_ item conform to specifications. The provisions at FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors--Commercial Items applies to this solicitation. Offerors shall include with the submission of their offer a completed copy of the provision at FAR 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications--Commercial Items. The clause at FAR 52.232-18, Availability of Funds applies to this solicitation. The clause at 52.219-8, Utilization of Small Business Concerns applies to this acquisition; The clause at FAR 52.211-6, Brand Name or Equal, applies to this acquisition. The clause at FAR 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions--Commercial Items applies to this acquisition. The clause at FAR 52.212-5, Contract Terms and conditions Required to Implement Statutes or Executive Orders--Commercial Items applies to this acquisition with addenda incorporating FAR clause(s) 52.222-26, Equal Opportunity; 52.222-35, Affirmative Action for Special Disabled and Vietnam ERA Veterans; 52.222-36, Affirmative Action for Handicapped Workers. The clause at DFARS 252.212-7001, Contract Terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes or Executive orders Applicable to Defense Acquisitions of Commercial items applies to this solicitation with addenda incorporating DFARS clause(s) 252.225-7001, Buy American Act and Balance of Payment Program. To be considered for award, bidders must also comply with DFARS 252.204-7004, Required Central Contractor Registration and DFARS 252.232-7009, Payment by Electronic Funds Transfer. Central Contractor Registration information can be obtained through the Internet at www.ccr2000.com. Offers shall be submitted via email or fax and received not later than 4:00 PM local time 21 January 2000. Fax number is (623) 856 3057. Title: LEASE 434TH/479TH INTERIM FACILITIES
PrimaryContactFullname: Maureen V Corpus
Description: The 347th Contracting Squadron at Moody AFB GA is seeking sources to provide temporary modular (trailers) facilities. These facilities are needed to create an office complex of approximately 16,000 SF. The office complex will house business offices, classrooms, and administrative space. All construction shall conform to commercial industry standards and Moody AFB requirements. Basic modular sizes are anticipated to be approximately 14' X 76'. All units must be delivered and set up as a turn-key facility by 1 Jun 00. Facilities will be needed for approximately 24 months. Utilities will be provided by the Government. Minor site preparation will be required. This acquisition will be 100% set-aside for small business. The Standard Industry Classification is 2451, 500 or fewer employees. Interested parties should contact Maureen Corpus at (912) 257-4712 or SrA Brian Mentel, (912) 257-2959 or e-mail kelly.dawsey@moody.af.mil.

Title: WIRELESS INFORMATION NETWORK CYBER-DEFENSE
PrimaryContactFullname: Joetta Bernhard, Contracting Officer, Phone (315) 330-2308, Fax (315) 330-7790, Email bernhard@rl.af.mil Joetta Bernhard
Description: s time period. The areas of interest include: 1) Development of integrated multi-layer techniques for the protection of mobile, ad-hoc wireless info networks, detection of attacks on them, and the reaction of the network nodes to these attacks once they have been detected.; 2) The broad range of physical, data link and network layer techniques to assure the availability, integrity, and confidentiality of the wireless networks, which will consist of both commercial and DoD specific assets, to include an assessment of the threats that may be presented to each of the layers; 3) Development of programmable, interoperable, common physical layer algorithms and link and network protocols that self-adapt to time-varying jammers, provide Low Probability of Intercept (LPI) capabilities and adapt to varying Quality of Service (QoS) requirements; 4) Hardware prototyping and proof-of-concept development/demonstration systems; 5) The broad range of innovative physical layer techniques for interference mitigation to assure availability. Specific technology and support programs include: 1) Application of new high-efficiency spread spectrum waveforms and interference mitigation algorithms to Mobile Radio Multiple Access networked systems to provide "on-demand' Anti-Jam/Low Probability of Intercept (AJ/LPI) capability; 2) Responsive, adaptive Link Control/Authentication Techniques; 3) Network layer protocols to utilize, secure, and connect to commercial wireless networks, and that assure security of routing updates and are resistant to spoofing; 4) Digital Watermarking for authentication of data; 5) Robust protocols for the transmission of ATM packets over wireless links; 6) Smart Networking Radio/DARPA GloMo technologies; emphasis is placed on the integration and insertion of advanced wireless information assurance technologies into existing and emerging networking infrastructures and systems and the extension of such capabilities into a larger network. Deliverables will be technical reports and, when appropriate, demonstrations. THIS ANNOUNCEMENT CONSTITUTES THE ENTIRE SOLICITATION. DO NOT SUBMIT A FORMAL PROPOSAL AT THIS TIME. EVALUATION CRITERIA: Proposals will be evaluated using the following criteria in descending order of importance: (1) overall scientific and technical merit; (2) potential contributions/relevance to the Air Force and DoD; (3) capabilities and experience; (4) plans and capabilities to accomplish technology transfer; and (5) total cost and cost realism. (NOTE: Cost realism will be used as an evaluation criterion only in proposals, which have significantly under or over estimated the cost to complete the effort). In addition, the Government will consider other factors, such as past and present performance on recent Government contracts and the capacity to perform the requirements of the effort. Offerers are

Title: MAINTENANCE AND REPAIR OF WATER WELLS
PrimaryContactFullname: Ken W Miller
Description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in subpart 12.6 as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; proposals are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. This solicitation, No F02604-00-Q0091 is issued as a Request for Quotation (RFQ). Funds for this acquisition are available. This solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 97-15. This acquisition is 100% set-aside for small business SIC: 1781 Size Std: $7.0. Contract Line Item(s):(CLIN) 0001; 1. SCOPE: The project covered by this statement of work consists in furnishing all plant, labor, equipment, appliances, and materials and performing all operations in connection with the complete repair of water well #11. All work will be in strict accordance with the terms and provisions of the contract. 2. REMOVAL AND REINSTALLATION OF A 250 HP MOTOR, SHAFT, AND BOWL ASSEMBLY TYPE 12 LKH: Contractor shall remove all well column assemblies and associated piping as necessary to determine the equipment malfunctions and facilitate the repair of well #11. All equipment and materials shall be neatly stacked on the ground at the job site. Suitable cover shall be provided to protect shaft threads. Disconnected pipes and well casing shall be capped to prevent contamination to the well site. The contractor shall reinstall the turbine pump and all other removed appurtenances after completion of specified work. 3. STERILIZATION: Disinfecting of the well by chlorinating will be accomplished by Government personnel after completion of the project. 4. WATER WELL PUMP WORK TO BE PERFORMED BY THE CONTRACTOR 4.1 Remove and reinstall oil-lubricated well, turbine pump, motor, and appurtenances in 18" diameter well. Bowl setting is at 590-foot level. 4.2 Contractor shall inspect the well components to determine the cause and extent of the malfunction. Upon completion of inspection, the contractor shall submit a report of findings and recommendations for repair to the Contracting Officer. Upon completion of review, the Contracting Officer will instruct the contractor to proceed. 4.3 REPLACEMENT PARTS: The contractor shall furnish and install all parts authorized by the Contracting Officer as required for repair of the pump column. 5. TESTS: After the installation is complete, and at such time as the Contracting Officer may direct, the contractor shall conduct an operation test for approval. The equipment shall be demonstrated to operate in accordance with the requirements of this specification. The test shall be performed in the presence of the Contracting Officer or their authorized representative. The contractor shall furnish all instruments and personnel required for the test. 6. SUBMITTALS: The contractor shall provide copies of pump curves and product data on all replaced parts. 7. WARRANTY: The contractor shall provide a 1-year warranty on all work and material. (CLIN 0002) 1. SCOPE: The project covered by this statement of work consists in furnishing all plant, labor, equipment, appliances, and materials and performing all operations in connection with complete inspection and repair of water well #14. All work will be in strict accordance with the terms and provisions of the contract. 2. REMOVE PUMP AND ALL PIPE, T.V., WELL CASING, AND REPAIR/REPLACE WELL COMPONENTS AS NECESSARY: Contractor shall remove all well pipe and components as necessary to allow for a television camera to be inserted into the existing well casing to determine the cause of well malfunction and to facilitate repair. All equipment and materials shall be neatly stacked on the ground at the job site. Suitable cover shall be provided to protect pipe threads. The well will be capped when work is halted for any extended period of time to prevent contamination. The contractor shall repair or replace all pump components and appurtenances after completion of specified work to ensure proper well operation. 3. STERILIZATION: Disinfecting of the well by chlorinating will be accomplished by Government personnel after completion of the project. 4. WATER WELL WORK TO BE PERFORMED BY THE CONTRACTOR 4.1 Remove the well pump and pipe to allow for the inspection of the well's casing using a television camera. Repair or replace a 125 hp, 460 volt, 1770 rpm pump and motor and associated components as required. Pump is set at 472 feet. 4.2 Contractor shall inspect the well casing using a television camera. Contractor will also inspect all other well components to determine the cause and extent of the well's malfunction. Upon completion of inspection, the contractor shall submit a report of findings and recommendations for repair to the Contracting Officer. Upon completion of review, the Contracting Officer will instruct the contractor to proceed. 4.3 The contractor shall furnish and install all parts authorized by the Contracting Officer as required for repair of the well. 5. TESTS: After the installation is complete, and at such time as the Contracting Officer may direct, the contractor shall conduct an operation test for approval. The equipment shall be demonstrated to operate in accordance with the requirements of this specification. The test shall be performed in the presence of the Contracting Officer or their authorized representative. The contractor shall furnish all instruments and personnel required for the test. 6. SUBMITTALS: the contractor shall provide copies of pump curves with well production data and manufacturer's product data on all replaced parts. 7. WARRANTY: The contractor shall provide a 1-year warranty on all work and material. This is a brand name or equal requirement the FAR Clause 52.211-6 applies. Basis of award: award will be made to the lowest-price Offeror, best demonstrating their ability to satisfy the technical capabilities of the items specified. Offerors of any equal must provide descriptive literature to this office for evaluation. Required delivery: 30 days ARO. FOB: Destination to Luke AFB, AZ. All prices shall include all Federal, State and Local taxes. The following FAR & DFARS provisions and clause(s) applies to this solicitation. FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors--Commercial Items, Far 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions-- commercial Items, FAR 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes or Executive Order--Commercial Items with addenda incorporating FAR clause(s) 52.222-26, Equal Opportunity; 52.222-35, Affirmative Action for Special Disabled and Vietnam ERA Veterans; 52.222-36, Affirmative Action for Workers with Disabilities; 52.222-41; DFARS 252.212-7001, Contract terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes or executive orders Applicable to Defense Acquisitions of Commercial Items with addenda incorporating DFARS clauses(s) 252.225-7001, Buy American Act and Balance of Payment Program, DFARS 252.204-7004 Required Central Contractor Registration (MAR 1998) (DFARS 204.7304). Offers shall be submitted in writing and received not later than 4:30 PM local time, 25 Jan 00. Arizona does not observe daylight savings time. Direct any questions or concerns to TSgt Ken Miller at (623) 856-7179 X 255. All proposals must be faxed to (623) 856-3438 or e-mail: ken.miller@luke.af.mil.

Title: SCRIPTOGRAPHIC PUBLICATIONS/BOOKLETS
PrimaryContactFullname: Tina Pettyjohn, Contract Manager, Phone (757)764-4187, Fax (757)764-9773, Email tina.pettyjohn@langley.af.mil - Lois Nicholson, Contracts Manager, Phone (757) 764-4726, Fax (757) 764-9773, Email lois.nicholson@langley.af.mil Tina Pettyjohn
Description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; proposals are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. This solicitation is issued as a request for quotation (RFQ). The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular (FAC) 97-14 and Defense FAR Supplement (DFARS) Change Notice 19991118. The standard industrial classification code is 2741, Miscellaneous Publishing, and the small business size standard is 500. This procurement is being conducted as a total small business set-aside. This combined synopsis/solicitation is for the procurement of scriptographic publications, which provide practical information, guidance, and organizational assistance to Air Force personnel and their families. Twelve separate publications and one tote are required, in various quantities, as specified in the following line items: Line Item 0001 _ Custom Totes/Envelopes with imprint (provided upon request), Quantity 21,800. The tote should bear an American flag motif and provides the perfect hiding place for a variety of documents. It_s constructed of a sturdy 16-point SBS board, and expands to hold 16 standard Scriptographic Booklets, a bundle of 8 12_ x 11_ papers, or a combination of both up to 1 Ó_ thick. It also features a convenient Velcro closure. Line Item 0002 _ Mission Readiness Guide, Quantity 19,960. A Personal And Family Guide (Active Duty edition). This guide is designed to help you meet the challenge of counseling service personnel and their families. The guide encompasses virtually every bit of information military family_s need before, during, and after deployment. Topics range from financial and legal matters to personal and emotional issues that arise between family members; _extra added attractions_ include a glossary of military terms, worksheets, check-lists, and places to record important phone numbers. Line Item 0003 _ Challenges of Deployments, Quantity 13,700. Tells how to deal with demands of deployment in a positive way. Promote advance preparation to ease the strain of separation and reunion, list sources to help. Line Item 0004 _ Family Care Plan, Quantity 12,400. Explains what information is needed to prepare a Family Care Plan, and give advice on planning for guardianship, medical needs, and legal and financial matters. Line Item 0005 _ Let_s Talk about Deployment, Quantity 13,950. Friendly characters and challenging word games encourage preteens to learn about their parent_s destination, find ways to keep in touch, and act responsibly at home. Talks about preparing for reunion. Line Item 0006 _ Until Your Parent Comes Home, Quantity 15,050. Fun-filled games, puzzles, and pictures to color offer a reassuring, entertaining way to explain deployment to elementary-school-age children, and help keep the military family close. Line Item 0007 _ My Book When Parents Goes Away, Quantity 16,150. Preschoolers might not know the word _deployment_, but they know how they feel when it happens. A friendly elephant, puzzles, and simple text help them accept sad feelings and find constructive things to do in their parent_s absence. Reminds them that their parents love them, and that their military family is special. Line Item _ 0008 Deployment Days Calendar, Quantity 17,200. Weeks of tips to keep family members on a positive track during deployment. Each month offers a different activity for keeping in touch and anticipating reunion. Flexible six-month format lets users write in year, month, and date desired. Line Item _ 0009 Write From the Heart Kit, Quantity 19,960. A stationary kit specially designed for deployed service members. It_s got everything a letter writer needs to assure family and friends that they are indeed loved and missed. Each kit contains: 1) one 32 page book of stationery with writing tips and mail-back cards geared toward adults an older children _ plus two greeting cards printed with special messages for spouses or significant others 2) one 32 page book of stationery with writing tips, games and activities, and mail-back cards appropriate for young children 3) 2 sticker sheets to decorate envelopes and letters or enclose in letters as gifts 4) 20 mailing envelopes 5) 1 durable kit envelope designed to fit comfortable in a Battle Dress Uniform (BDU) cargo pocket, helmet bag, or duffel bag. Line Item 0010 _ Preparing for Mobilization, Quantity 500. Gives Reserve families insight into the transition to military life. Discusses levels and phases of mobilization, plans to make in advance, emotional concerns, communication, reunion, and more. Line Item 0011 _ Make the Most of Family Support Groups (FSG_s), Quantity 200. Booklets introduce FSG_s; tell how they meet family needs, services offered, and more. Encourage readers to organize an FSG; describe the process and services they can include in their program. Line Item 0012 _ Your Parent is Coming Home, Quantity 400. Games and puzzles help prepare elementary-school-age children for the return of a deployed parent. Talks about changes and feelings kids might experience; reassures them of their parent_s love. Line Item 0013 _ Lets Talk Reunion, Quantity 300. An excellent additional to any discussion on reunion and it_s impact on family members. Offers advice on minimizing stress; underscores the role preteens can play in a successful reunion. Line Item 0014 _ Twenty-one (21) Imprints (upon request), Quantity 19. Line Item 0015 _ Shipping Charges (if, applicable). Delivery of each item line item should be made No Later Than 30 days after receipt of order to multiple Air Combat Command (ACC) Bases throughout the United States and one base in Lajes Field, Azores (Shipping list available upon request). Terms and Conditions_Commercial Clauses and Provisions. The following Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) and Defense FAR Supplement (DFARS) clauses and provisions are incorporated herein: FAR 52.252-1, Solicitation Provisions Incorporated by Reference, FEB 1998, (IAW FAR 52.107(a)). This RFQ incorporates one or more solicitation provisions by reference, with the same force and effect as if they were given in full text. Upon request, the Contracting Officer will make their full text available. The offeror is cautioned that the listed provisions may include blocks that must be completed by the offeror and submitted with its quotation or offer. In lieu of submitting the full text of those provisions, the offeror may identify the provision by paragraph identifier and provide the appropriate information with its quotation or offer. Also, the full text of a solicitation provision may be accessed electronically at this/these address(es): FAR Provisions: http://farsite.hill.af.mil/reghtml/far/52_toc.htm, DFARS Provisions 252.201 to 252.214: http://farsite.hill.af.mil/reghtml/dfars/dfars252_000.htm, DFARS Provisions 252.215 to 252.219: http://farsite.hill.af.mil/reghtml/dfars/dfars252_215.htm, DFARS Provisions 252.220 to 252.226: http://farsite.hill.af.mil/reghtml/dfars/dfars252_220.htm, DFARS Provisions 252.227 to 252.231: http://farsite.hill.af.mil/reghtml/dfars/dfars252_227.htm,DFARS Provisions 252.232 to 252.236: http://farsite.hill.af.mil/reghtml/dfars/dfars252_232.htm, DFARS Provisions 252.237 to 252.245: http://farsite.hill.af.mil/reghtml/dfars/dfars252_237.htm, DFARS Provisions 252.246 to 252.251: http://farsite.hill.af.mil/reghtml/dfars/dfars252_246.htm, FAR 52.252-2, Clauses Incorporated by Reference, FEB 1998 (IAW FAR 52.107(b)) FAR 52.212-5, Provisions Required for Submission. Title: TECHNICAL SUPPORT FOR MULTIFUNCTIONAL SECURE GATEWAY LITE SOFTWARE
PrimaryContactFullname: Nora W Ball
Description: The ACC Contracting Squadron intends to award a purchase order, under other than full and open competition, to Cavalier Communications, Inc. to provide technical support for the Multifunctional Secure Gateway (MSG) Lite Software. Support shall consist of providing telephone technical assistance to resolve software problems/anomalies and providing software version updates as they occur. This support is required for 16 CONUS Air Combat Command sites for a period of 12 months. MSG Lite is a proprietary software product of Cavalier Communications Inc., and technical support is unavailable from any other source. The Air Force intends to conduct this procurement in accordance with Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) Part 12, Acquisition of Commercial Items. This proposed procurement is for supplies and services for which the government intends to solicit and negotiate with only one source. Interested parties may respond in writing to the ACC Contracting Squadron. Responses must be received not later than 30 Dec 99. Responses must include written documentation providing conclusive evidence that the offeror is able to provide the described technical support. Responses shall be submitted in sufficient detail to enable accomplishment of a thorough technical evaluation. All responses submitted in accordance with the instructions provided herein will be evaluated by the Contracting Officer on the basis of the information submitted. Responses will be accepted at the mail address identified herein and by facsimile machine at (757) 764-9773 (Attn: N. Ball/K. Hawkins). All responsible sources may submit a response that shall be considered by the agency. If no responses are received, or all responses are found to be technically unacceptable, the procurement will proceed under other than full and open competition as described herein.
